ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Anybody interested in sociology should take this class

I would recommend the class only if one needs it to complete the major or distributional requirements. I would not take it just for fun. Only two papers- midterm (7-10) and final (10-12). Two review papers for two books we read also; they were short.
Norms and Deviance is a phenomenal class with Elijah Anderson!
Incredibly interesting course that will shift the way you observe the world and behavior of those around you. Professor Anderson lectures for a majority of the course but is far from dry.
If you are interested in norms of power and privilege, it's a great course!
An immense amount of reading. The midterm and final are actually papers, not exams. Interesting material, to be sure, but a lot of work even if taken for credit.
